title: Lake Hillier
subtitle: An Australian lake whose pink hue defies scientific explanation.

title: Glowworm Tunnel
subtitle: An abandoned railroad tunnel is now filled with bioluminescent bugs.

title: Gippsland Lakes Bioluminescence
subtitle: Australian Lake set aglow by Noctiluca Scintillans.

title: Paronella Park
subtitle: A castle hand built by a Spanish dreamer in the Australian tropical jungle.

title: Newnes Glow Worm Tunnel
subtitle: Once the path of a railway tunnel, now home to thousands of glowing insects.

title: Österreichische Nationalbibliothek (Austrian National Library)
subtitle: The beautiful baroque library of the Hapsburg empire.

title: Stephansdom Crypt
subtitle: The crypt of the imposing Stephensdom holds royal intestines and thousands of skeletons.

title: Clock Museum
subtitle: A small museum filled with over 1,000 clocks, and one particular clock calibrated to run until the year 9999.

title: Habsburg Imperial Crypt
subtitle: The final resting place for the remains of 143 Habsburg royalty.

title: Schmetterlinghaus: The Imperial Butterfly Park
subtitle: A tropical paradise just a short trip from the opera house, filled with beautiful winged creatures for your enjoyment.

title: Caño Cristales
subtitle: An explosion of natural color known as "the river that ran away from paradise."

title: Las Lajas Sanctuary
subtitle: A dangling church built over a Colombian gorge.

title: Tequendama Falls Museum
subtitle: This picturesque mansion has gone from opulent ruin to nature museum.

title: Guatapé
subtitle: The Andean town where every single building is decorated with a brightly colored frieze.

title: Cave of Splendor
subtitle: Enchanting cave with a river crashing through the roof.

title: Aviarios del Caribe: Sloth Sanctuary
subtitle: Sloth rehabilitation center in the jungle of Costa Rica.

title: Río Celeste
subtitle: This neon blue river gets its color from a unique mix of bacteria and volcano minerals.

title: Territorio de Zaguates (Land of Strays)
subtitle: Where dogs like the rare "Fire-Tailed Border Cocker" run free on the mountainside.

title: Parque Francisco Alvarado
subtitle: This Costa Rican topiary park is a surreal garden of unearthly delights.

title: Diquís Spheres
subtitle: These mysterious ancient stone spheres were created by a civilization lost to time and are now mostly lawn ornaments.

title: Blue Cave of Bisevo
subtitle: An ethereal glowing blue ocean cave in Croatia.

title: Plitvice Lakes
subtitle: A chain of 16 wondrous lakes formed as a result of the gradual dissolution of soluble layers of bedrock.

title: Sea Organ
subtitle: A musical instrument played by the sea.

title: Zagreb's Museum of Broken Relationships
subtitle: Where the lovelorn find a home for their sentimental keepsakes.

title: Podgaric Monument
subtitle: This stunning, out-of-the-way Croatian monument commemorates a community's uprising against occupying fascist forces.

title: KGB Museum
subtitle: "There's nothing there," and other lies the KGB told us.

title: Rummu Underwater Prison
subtitle: The ruins of an Estonian prison are drowning in the quarry lake where the convicts were once forced to work.

title: Kaali Meteorite Crater Field
subtitle: Mysterious craters may have been home to an ancient cult.

title: Pähni Megaphones
subtitle: A trio of giant wooden megaphones turn up nature's volume in this Estonian forest.

title: Tuhala Witch's Well
subtitle: This disappearing geyser has been attributed to witchcraft, but really it's all about rainfall.

title: Catacombes de Paris
subtitle: The Catacombs hold secrets much stranger than the bones stacked within them.

title: Museum of Vampires and Legendary Creatures
subtitle: The macabre collection of Jacques Sirgent, an expert scholar on the undead and all of their trappings.

title: Père Lachaise Cemetery
subtitle: France's most famous cemetery, with some of its most curious tombs.

title: Petite Ceinture
subtitle: Abandoned railway line circling the city of Paris.

title: 59 Rivoli
subtitle: Notorious artist squat renovated into legal studios.

title: Spreepark
subtitle: An eerie derelict amusement park sits abandoned in Berlin.

title: Rakotzbrücke Devil's Bridge
subtitle: This jaw-dropping 19th-century bridge uses its reflection to form what appears to be a perfect circle.

title: Berliner Unterwelten (Subterranean Berlin)
subtitle: A tour of underground Berlin takes you through WWII air raid shelters and tunnels used to smuggle people out of East Germany.

title: Monster Kabinett
subtitle: Part art gallery, part haunted house, this robotic art display is a terrifying experience.

title: Neuschwanstein Castle
subtitle: The fairy tale castle of the "fairy-tale king."

title: Meteora
subtitle: Monasteries on rock pillars, once accessible only by frayed ropes.

title: The Oracle of Delphi
subtitle: The hallucinogenic center of the ancient world.

title: Sami
subtitle: A spectacular cave and a beguiling lake.

title: Navagio Beach
subtitle: Hidden in a secluded Greek cove is a pristine beach marred only by the rusting smuggler's hulk stranded on its shores.

title: Tourlitis Lighthouse
subtitle: Perched on a spindly rock spire in a Greek archipelago, this lighthouse would make a perfect wizard's tower.

title: For Sale Pub
subtitle: This Budapest bar allows drinkers to leave their mark on the walls, floor, and even ceiling.

title: Szabo Ervin Library
subtitle: A 19th century artistocrat's mansion, turned into a library, hidden in a modern library.

title: Shoes on the Danube Promenade
subtitle: A trail of iron footwear stands as a monument to the thousands executed along this riverbank during WWII.

title: Panoptikum Budapest
subtitle: A series of caves under Castle Hill that once held the prisoner Vlad Tepes, better known as Count Dracula.

title: Vajdahunyad Castle
subtitle: This Hungarian castle was built out of cardboard and wood until it proved so popular that it got upgraded to stone.

title: For Sale Pub
subtitle: This Budapest bar allows drinkers to leave their mark on the walls, floor, and even ceiling.

title: Szabo Ervin Library
subtitle: A 19th century artistocrat's mansion, turned into a library, hidden in a modern library.

title: Shoes on the Danube Promenade
subtitle: A trail of iron footwear stands as a monument to the thousands executed along this riverbank during WWII.

title: Panoptikum Budapest
subtitle: A series of caves under Castle Hill that once held the prisoner Vlad Tepes, better known as Count Dracula.

title: Vajdahunyad Castle
subtitle: This Hungarian castle was built out of cardboard and wood until it proved so popular that it got upgraded to stone.

title: Valle dei Mulini (Valley of the Mills)
subtitle: An Italian crevasse filled with abandoned buildings gives visitors a look at the world without humans.

title: Santa Maria della Concezione Crypts
subtitle: The crypts of Capuchin friars decorated with the bones of over 4,000 friars, including an entire "crypt of pelvises."

title: The Monsters of Bomarzo
subtitle: A 16th-century horror show built in a lovely Italian garden.

title: Torre Argentina (Roman Cat Sanctuary)
subtitle: Hundreds of lucky felines haunt the ruins where Caesar was murdered.

title: The Sunken City of Baia
subtitle: A submerged archeological park still holds the wonders of a Roman Sodom.

title: The Corner House
subtitle: A former Latvian headquarters of the brutal KGB secret police is now open as a grim reminder of their atrocities.

title: Riga Central Market
subtitle: 3,000 market stands in five former Zeppelin hangars.

title: Art Nouveau in Riga
subtitle: Flamboyant architecture from the turn of 20th century.

title: Liepaja Northern Forts
subtitle: These crumbling Latvian forts make for some haunting seaside ruins.

title: Cinevilla
subtitle: Spend the night in 1920s Latvia.

title: Hill of Witches
subtitle: Lithuania's outdoor sculpture trail of wooden folk art.

title: Hill of Crosses
subtitle: An old hill fort covered in over 100,000 crosses is a symbol of Lithuanian nationalism and beliefs.

title: Vilnil Museum of Illusions
subtitle: Things aren't quite what they seem at this mind-bending museum.

title: Europos Parkas
subtitle: A curious art sculpture park in the geographic center of Europe.

title: Juodasis Vaiduoklis (The Black Ghost)
subtitle: A creepy statue of a hooded ghost hauls itself up from the water in a historic Lithuanian city.

title: Popeye Village
subtitle: An abandoned set from the 1980 film "Popeye," claimed and repurposed as a theme park by creative locals.

title: Mnajdra
subtitle: Stone Age solar temple is aligned with the sun on each equinox and solstice.

title: Maltese Catacomb Complexes
subtitle: Burial grounds for more than 1,000 bodies deep under the modern town of Rabat.

title: Ħal Saflieni Hypogeum
subtitle: This subterranean necropolis holds three floors of antler-dug grave caves.

title: Secret Passage in St. Gregory's
subtitle: A hidden tunnel of bones in one of Malta's oldest churches.

title: Electric Ladyland: The Museum of Fluorescent Art
subtitle: The world's only museum devoted to the wonders of fluorescence.

title: Nieuwe Spiegelstraat
subtitle: An Amsterdam street lined with antique shops each one dedicated to a different obscure collection.

title: The Torture Museum
subtitle: Museum preserving torture methods from the past.

title: De Poezenboot (The Cat Boat)
subtitle: A floating cat sanctuary on an Amsterdam canal.

title: KattenKabinet
subtitle: Cat art as far as the eye can see.

title: Hobbiton
subtitle: The real life Hobbiton, this sheep farm has been forever transformed since being built for The Hobbit film series.

title: Waitomo Glowworm Caves
subtitle: Tubing through a cave lit with glowworms is a magical underground experience.

title: Milford Sound
subtitle: Dolphins, ancient clams and hundreds of waterfalls make this one of the world's top tourist destinations.

title: Castle Hill
subtitle: The Dalai Lama named this New Zealand landscape the "Spiritual Center of the Universe."

title: That Wanaka Tree
subtitle: A solitary tree has grown up all alone on Lake Wanaka, backdropped by the beautiful Southern Alps.

title: Trolltunga
subtitle: Walk 2,300 feet above the ground on the "Troll's Tongue."

title: Atlantic Road
subtitle: A serpentine highway twists and turns over the treacherous Norwegian Sea.

title: Uredd Rest Area (Ureddplassen)
subtitle: Norway has built what may be the world's most beautiful public toilet.

title: Kjeragbolten
subtitle: This giant boulder is pinched over a 1000-meter abyss by two mountains.

title: Preikestolen
subtitle: This "preacher's pulpit" once used for pagan ritual, is home to a new, and dangerous ritual.

title: Machu Picchu: The Lost City of The Inca
subtitle: The intricate stonework of Machu Picchu serves as a testament to Incan engineers.

title: Q'eswachaka Rope Bridge
subtitle: Keshwa chaca, among the last handwoven Incan bridges, crosses Apurimac Canyon in Peru.

title: Rainbow Mountain
subtitle: A remote candy-striped mountain in the Peruvian Andes straight out of the pages of Dr. Seuss.

title: Convento de San Francisco Ossuary
subtitle: The mortal remains of an estimated 70,000 people lie in the basement of a monastery in Lima, Peru.

title: The Boiling River of the Amazon
subtitle: This scalding hot river was thought to be a myth until one geoscientist made it his quest to study the mystical waters.

title: Kaplica Czaszek: The Chapel of Skulls
subtitle: The walls and ceiling of this Polish church are decorated with thousands of skulls, with another 21,000 skeletons just below.

title: Crooked Forest
subtitle: Countless stories attempt to explain Poland's mysterious J-shaped trees.

title: Wieliczka Salt Mine
subtitle: An underground city of salt.

title: Rynek Underground
subtitle: Beneath Kraków Old Town's main square lies a hologram-filled medieval market vampire graveyard wonderland.

title: The Bones of the Wawel Dragon
subtitle: Real bones which are said to have belonged to a Polish dragon.

title: Corvin Castle
subtitle: This Romanian fairytale castle would make Dracula (who is said to have been imprisoned there) jealous.

title: Bigar Waterfall
subtitle: Moss and stone turn this waterfall into an otherworldly liquid veil.

title: Salina Turda
subtitle: This massive underground salt mine now holds a sci-fi theme park in its depths.

title: Hoia-Baciu Forest
subtitle: Some call this eerie forest of crooked trees the "Bermuda Triangle of Romania."

title: Peleș Castle
subtitle: This elaborately decorated, fairytale-like Romanian royal palace is one of the most striking castles in Europe.

title: Dargavs Village: City of the Dead
subtitle: This ancient village and its adjoining cemetery have a beautiful history of death and remembrance.

title: Bunker-42
subtitle: Dr. Strangelove-esque tours inside a bunker under Moscow's streets once reserved for Stalin himself.

title: Izmailovo Kremlin
subtitle: Moscow's other, lesser known kremlin is a fairytale-like cultural complex modeled after Old Russia.

title: Lenin's Mausoleum
subtitle: Embalmed remains of the leader of the Bolshevik Revolution.

title: Psychedelic Salt Mines
subtitle: It's hard to believe the dizzying patterns covering this abandoned mine are completely natural.

title: Predjama Castle
subtitle: Castle and secret tunnel withstood a siege until its owner was killed by the Holy Roman Empire, while sitting on the toilet.

title: Skocjan Caves
subtitle: This massive subterranean fissure is known as the "underground Grand Canyon."

title: Bled Island and Castle
subtitle: This one-time health resort was used by aristocrats around the world.

title: Postojna caves
subtitle: A miniature train-ride through Slovenia's largest cave system.

title: Dragon Bridge
subtitle: A whimsical bridge adorned with decorative dragons.

title: Sagrada Família
subtitle: Construction of Barcelona's iconic (but controversial) church is expected to be completed in 2026—a century after the death of its architect.

title: Casa Batlló
subtitle: One of Antoni Gaudí's most classic buildings is well-known for its "dragon-back" design.

title: Labyrinth Park of Horta
subtitle: This semi-secret storybook hedge maze is also the oldest garden in the city.

title: Ronda, Spain
subtitle: Three bridges and one giant canyon make up this fantastic Spanish settlement.

title: Calder Mercury Fountain
subtitle: A beautiful but toxic fountain of mercury.

subtitle: The beautiful baroque library of the Hapsburg empire.

subtitle: A beautiful but toxic fountain of mercury.

title: H.R. Giger Museum
subtitle: The bizarre visions of H.R. Giger, tucked away in a Swiss medieval city.

title: Berggasthaus Aescher Wildkirchli
subtitle: This 170-year-old Swiss guesthouse built into the side of a mountain is best accessed by a cable car.

title: Hammetschwand Elevator
subtitle: The tallest outdoor elevator in Europe rockets passengers on a dizzyingly precarious ride to the top of a mountain.

title: Trift Bridge
subtitle: This amazing pedestrian suspension bridge in the Swiss Alps would give Indiana Jones nightmares.

title: St. Beatus Cave
subtitle: Caves famous for the dragon-slaying saint who lived there.

title: Cappadocia
subtitle: In this historic region, homes and churches are carved into ancient volcanic rock formations.

title: Pamukkale Water Terraces
subtitle: Roman ruins top white travertine terraces formed by ancient hot springs.

title: Basilica Cisterns of Istanbul
subtitle: A marvel of Byzantine engineering under the streets of Istanbul.

title: Lycian Rock Tombs
subtitle: These tombs were built into the side of a mountain so that ancient angels could reach the dead.

title: Myra Necropolis
subtitle: A Lycian city of the dead carved into the hillside of Southern Turkey, complete with startlingly human touches.

title: City Hall Station
subtitle: A beautiful and abandoned New York subway station from 1904, complete with chandelier.

title: The Evolution Store
subtitle: A terrific purveyor of natural history objects and curios.

title: Dream House
subtitle: La Monte Young and Marian Zazeela's "Dream House" will immerse you in an ever changing world of sound and light.
